name: Local device management and global initialization
Created by Jan Ekstr√∏m - 2024-09-27 - v1.06 (Open to view Version History)
info:
By jan.ekstrom@dk.ibm.com

v1.06 2024-09-27:  
- Get the ID (RPE-name) from the Pi's hostname rather than waiting for all MQTT connections to be connected

v1.05 2023-12-04:  
- Renamed the standard MQTT out nodes to a more generic RPE042-<device>-<number>
- Filtered the IP address to only contain the IPv4 address (both IPv4 and IPv6 was way too long)

v1.04 2023-01-12:
- Deleted old mqtt nodes (EUDemo & CSUK18 MAM's) and cleaned up the configurations.

v1.03 2022-12-29:
- Cleaned up the Collect And Send Data flow and split up the data to three data sets 
  each having it's own MQTT connection to a device in MAS Monitor.
- Commented out the pre-set environment data to be used only if the SenseHAT is missing
- Changed Shutdown from Control flow to behave as shutdown via the joystick


v1.02 2022-12-28:
- Added three mqtt out nodes for CPU, OSC and ENV including the configurations.
- Added "measurement" timestamps (evt_timestamp) for each of the three data sets, 
  so they have different timestamps simulating separate individual devices.

v1.01 2022-12-28:
- Preparing for the RPE on MAS flows, including removing support for External TEMPerHUM sensor 
  and removal of some superflous flows.

v0.45 2022-12-28:
- Updated version based on several additional flows have been added over the time to test 
  e.g. connectiong to a MAS Monitor instance (both as device and gateway).

v0.44 2020-08-10:
- Added support for TEMPerHUM USB Temperature & Humidity Sensor as provider of 
  External Temperature and Humidity (xt, xh).

v0.43 2020-06-10:
- Added the Get Ext data flow to listen to a local Mosquitto broker and receive 
  from an ESP32 board with an attached DHT22 (AM2302) sensor.

v0.42 2020-05-20:
- Moved the header info creation from dashboard to Collect An Send Data, 
  as a refresh of the UI Dashboard would make it dissapear. 
  Now it will automatically be induced into the header again when data is collected and send.
- Added the ID name as the first text to be displayed on the SenseHat, when pushing UP.

v0.41 2020-05-14:
- Added RPE information in the right side of the header on the dashboard, e.g. RPE001 (v0.41)

V0.40 2020-05-13:
- Added 4 bars on the SenseHAT LEDs to indicate: CPU Load, CPU Temperature, Oscillator Temperature, Environment Temperature from the SenseHAT
  There are 5 LEDs on each bar: 2
  < 0 1 green, 
  < 40 2 green, 
  < 60 3green, 
  < 80 3 green + 1 yellow, 
  < 100 3 green + 1 yellow + 1 red

v0.37 2020-05-11:
- Tidy up some code in function nodes; removed superfluous code and debug nodes.
- Moved collecting hardware version to the Control tab and stored in a global variable as it will never change.
- Added Joystick function to show SW and HW versions on the SenseHAT
- Added SW and HW versions to the RPE Control tab of the dashboard

v0.35 2020-05-10:
- Added logic for showing the status of the MQTT connections on the LED (0,7)

v0.30 2020-05-07:
- Added property for RPE software version.
- Added property for hardware version.
- Added properties for future eXternal DHT22 sensor: 
  Temperature and Humidity
- Set default global variables for SenseHAT and DHT22 sensors, so that the flow can run on Pi's with or without those sensors attached.

v0.20 2020-05-06:
- Added ENTER on joystick to toggle the LED display on and off.
- Added LEDs in lowest row to indicate MQTT connection state (not working yet - shows green) and the day of the week (green: Active - red: Inactive)

v0.15 2020-05-05:
- Added CRON+ to control when the measurements are being collected and transmitted + when the load tests are being performed:
Active:   Monday-Friday 8am - 6pm CET
          Every 10 seconds
Inactive: All other periods
          Every 20 minutes
- Added SenseHAT properties: Temperature, Humidity and Pressure


v0.12 2020-05-04:
- Added local dashboard
- Added MQTT to send data
- Added the Oscilator properties: 
  Frequency, Voltage and Temperature


v0.10 2020-05-01:
- Initial flows.
- Using various CLI commands to gather sensor data every 10 seconds.
- Run a 5 minute load test at 100% and the 10 minutes idleing.
- Using CPU Load, CPU Temperature, Disk Usage and Free Memory

func:
// Select the values to display
flow.set('CPU_Load', msg.payload.cl); //CPU Load
flow.set('CPU_Temp', msg.payload.ct); //CPU Temperature
flow.set('Osc_Temp', msg.payload.ot); //Oscillator Temperature
flow.set('Sense_Temp', msg.payload.et); //SenseHAT Temperature

name: Software Version
This script handles the scheduled load test generation
This flow takes care of the local dashboard
Toolbar
format:
<script id="titleScript" type="text/javascript">
    $('#titlewords').remove();
    var toolbar = $('#nr-dashboard-toolbar');
    //var div = $('<div style="text-align:left; padding-left:10px; width:100%;"/>');
    var div = $('<div style="position: absolute; right: 20px; top: 5px; height: 30px;"/>');
    var p = $('<p/ id="titlewords">');
    
    $('#titleScript').parent().hide();
    div.append(p);
    toolbar.append(div);

    function displayTitle(lh) {
        p.text(lh); 
    }

    // Watch the payload and update the title
    (function(scope) {
        scope.$watch('msg.payload', function(data) {
            displayTitle(data);
        });
    })(scope);
</script>

name: Toolbar
format:
<script id="titleScript" type="text/javascript">
    $('#titlewords').remove();
    var toolbar = $('#nr-dashboard-toolbar');
    //var div = $('<div style="text-align:left; padding-left:10px; width:100%;"/>');
    var div = $('<div style="position: absolute; right: 20px; top: 5px; height: 30px;"/>');
    var p = $('<p/ id="titlewords">');
    
    $('#titleScript').parent().hide();
    div.append(p);
    toolbar.append(div);

    function displayTitle(lh) {
        p.text(lh); 
    }

    // Watch the payload and update the title
    (function(scope) {
        scope.$watch('msg.payload', function(data) {
            displayTitle(data);
        });
    })(scope);
</script>
